intro: Ilysanthes dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features strap-like leaves that are typically broad and lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ilysanthes dilatata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
